item.title: Sarah add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "This first glance of a soul which does not yet know itself is like dawn in the heavens; it is the awakening of something radiant and unknown." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I was with book, as a woman is with child." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "To love another person is to see the face of God." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He who opens a school door, closes a prison." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "It is nothing to die. It is frightful not to live." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Certainly we talk to ourselves; there is no thinking being who has not experienced that. One could even say that the word is never a more magnificent mystery than when, within a man, it travels from his thought to his conscience and returns from his conscience to his thought. This is the only sense of the words, so often used in this chapter, “he said,” “he exclaimed”; we say to ourselves, we speak to ourselves, we exclaim within ourselves, without breaking the external silence. There is great tumult within; everything within us speaks, except the tongue. The realities of the soul, though not visible and palpable, are nonetheless realities. (pg. 226)" -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Sarah add a quote by victor hugos
item.description: "If I speak, I am condemned. If I stay silent, I am damned!" -- victor hugos

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "There is always more misery among the lower classes than there is humanity in the higher." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "When love has fused and mingled two beings in a sacred and angelic unity, the secret of life has been discovered so far as they are concerned; they are no longer anything more than the two boundaries of the same destiny; they are no longer anything but the two wings of the same spirit. Love, soar." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Diamonds are to be found only in the darkness of the earth, and truth in the darkness of the mind. " -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Good actions are the invisible hinges on the doors of heaven." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Victor hugo
item.description: "Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silent" -- Victor hugo
